page.title: 10PUBLIC HOUSES IN WYTHALL
page.content: {The Horse and Jockey}is on the A435 to Alcester.Weekday customers are mainly businessmen and local farmers. Weekend customers are families from other areas.Serving food increases trade so barbeques, discos and a garden are added attractions. {The Coach & Horses}lies at the foot of Weatheroak Hill where Ryknild St.Roman Road crosses the road to Alvechurch. I studied the barrels behind the bar. There were many kinds of beer. I thought the bar was strange because the glasses were hung over the bar. {The Peacock}is at the top of Weatheroak Hill where Ryknild Street joins the Birmingham Boundary.The regular customers are from local farms amd houses.The bar was a little place at the back of the lounge.It has a garden, which is very popular in summer. {SILVERMEAD.}
